title: Liverpool news: Mohamed Salah injury update ahead of Manchester United clash
text:
Mohamed Salah limped out of Liverpool’s victory against Leicester before the international break (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool expect Mohamed Salah to be fit to start in Sunday’s clash against Manchester United at Old Trafford.

The Egyptian came off in injury time of Liverpool’s 2-1 win against Leicester City before the international break after taking a knock in a nasty challenge from Foxes midfielder Hamza Choudhury.

Salah was sent for a scan on the injury but Liverpool were relieved when the results showed that he had survived the tackle without serious injury.

Nevertheless, the Egyptian’s involvement in Sunday’s clash at the Theatre of Dreams was considered touch and go but the Liverpool Echo report that Salah is fit to start.

Salah’s scan showed he hadn’t sustained serious damage (Picture: Getty)

Salah’s availability will be a huge boost for Liverpool, who also expect to have Alisson Bekcer to call on again.

The goalkeeper has managed just one appearance so far this term but has now recovered from the calf injury he sustained against Norwich on August 9th.

The Brazilian is expected to replace Adrian in goal against the Red Devils, who have significant injury worries of their own.

Anthony Martial, Paul Pogba and Luke Shaw all face fitness tests to determine their availability.

Aaron Wan-Bissaka is expected to return after missing the last two matches with illness.

Liverpool have won 17 Premier League matches in a row and can equal Manchester City’s record with a win at Old Trafford.
